They may also conclude that 2018&#8217;s perils vastly exceeded those before. For now, though, here are some folk from this column who helped give 2017 its [&#8230;]</description><source>Health</source><pubDate>Fri, 29 Dec 2017 18:18:06 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/16516145.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /><a10:link rel="external" type="text/html" title="Town Talk: Folk who helped make 2017 what it was" href="http://vancouversun.com/entertainment/celebrity/town-talk-folk-who-helped-make-2017-what-it-was" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=16500325</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/health/local-health/housing+anxiety+drives+residents+seek+professional/16500325/story.html</link><title>Housing anxiety drives B.C. residents to seek professional help</title><description>As hope fades that Metro Vancouver&#8217;s housing crisis will end anytime soon, counsellors say they are helping more clients tackle the shame and misery that comes from sleeping in rodent-infested basement suites or staying with abusive partners while struggling to find a better home. Clients are identifying housing as having a major impact on their [&#8230;]</description><source>Health</source><pubDate>Fri, 29 Dec 2017 18:09:08 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/16500326.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /><a10:link rel="external" type="text/html" title="Housing anxiety drives B.C. residents to seek professional help" href="http://vancouversun.com/health/local-health/b-c-counsellors-see-more-clients-struggling-with-housing-anxiety" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=16514784</guid><link>http://nationalpost.com/news/world/stranger-than-science-seven-really-weird-discoveries-from-2017</link><title>Stranger than science: Seven really weird discoveries from 2017</title><description>From a two headed porpoise to a pig-human hybrid, scientists have made a lot of weird discoveries this year</description><source>Health</source><pubDate>Fri, 29 Dec 2017 15:16:11 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/16515743.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /><a10:link rel="external" type="text/html" title="Stranger than science: Seven really weird discoveries from 2017" href="http://nationalpost.com/news/world/stranger-than-science-seven-really-weird-discoveries-from-2017" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=16496547</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/health/local-health/years+resolutions+that+might+actually+make+happy/16496547/story.html</link><title>New Years resolutions that might actually make you happy</title><description>You are an addict. We all are. And the sooner we admit that we have a problem and that our lives have become unmanageable, the sooner the healing can begin. If that sounds a bit like the First Step at an Alcoholics Anonymous meeting, that&#8217;s because it is. If you sense your own unhappiness and [&#8230;]</description><source>Health</source><pubDate>Thu, 28 Dec 2017 23:00:34 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/16496549.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /><a10:link rel="external" type="text/html" title="New Years resolutions that might actually make you happy" href="http://vancouversun.com/news/local-news/resolutions-how-quitting-the-internet-can-make-you-healthier-wealthier-and-happier" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=16493309</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/news/world/woman+went+into+labour+grocery+store+butcher+helped+deliver/16493309/story.html</link><title>A woman went into labour at a grocery store — and the butcher helped deliver it</title><description>After 25 minutes of chaos, she did what many would do. 'I went live from Facebook,' she said</description><source>Health</source><pubDate>Thu, 28 Dec 2017 20:52:50 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/16493310.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /><a10:link rel="external" type="text/html" title="A woman went into labour at a grocery store — and the butcher helped deliver it" href="http://nationalpost.com/news/world/a-woman-went-into-labour-at-a-grocery-store-and-the-butcher-helped-deliver-it" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=16491545</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/health/fitness/fitness+column+active+healthy+living+provides+better/16491545/story.html</link><title>Fitness column: Active, healthy living provides better results than what social media stars peddle</title><description>Here&#8217;s a New Year&#8217;s resolution question I never get asked. &#8220;Is pairing a balanced diet with vigorous physical activity the best way to achieve one&#8217;s health and fitness goals?&#8221; More likely, I&#8217;m being asked about a diet that attempts to replicate primal eating patterns (weeds and mammoth) or the single best exercise to carve new-found [&#8230;]</description><source>Health</source><pubDate>Thu, 28 Dec 2017 19:03:07 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/16491547.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /><a10:link rel="external" type="text/html" title="Fitness column: Active, healthy living provides better results than what social media stars peddle" href="http://edmontonjournal.com/health/diet-fitness/fitness-column-active-healthy-living-provides-better-results-than-what-social-media-stars-peddle" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=16491023</guid><link>http://nationalpost.com/health/health-and-wellness/is-modern-life-too-much-for-you-maybe-a-tiny-box-in-the-woods-is-the-cure</link><title>Is modern life too much for you? Maybe a tiny box in the woods is the cure</title><description>Start-up Getaway and others like the Tiny Homes Hotel in Austin let stressed city dwellers taste a much simpler existence</description><source>Health</source><pubDate>Thu, 28 Dec 2017 18:48:31 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/16491024.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /><a10:link rel="external" type="text/html" title="Is modern life too much for you? and &#8216;baby&#8217; were never mentioned in the newspapers of the time.&#160; Editor&#8217;s note: As we prepare to usher in 2018, it&#8217;s important that we here in [&#8230;]</description><source>Health</source><pubDate>Thu, 28 Dec 2017 15:28:40 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/16473620.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /><a10:link rel="external" type="text/html" title="2017 In Stories: Illegal, taboo and potentially deadly: Understanding the history of abortion in Ottawa" href="http://ottawacitizen.com/health/women/2017-in-stories-illegal-taboo-and-potentially-deadly-understanding-the-history-of-abortion-in-ottawa" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=16487868</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/health/diet-fitness/nutrition+food+trends+2018+22plant+based+tops+charts/16487868/story.html</link><title>Top Nutrition and Food Trends for 2018: "plant based" tops the charts</title><description>Top 3 trends in the food, restaurant and grocery industry. As both a foodie and Canada nutrition expert I&#8217;m always fascinated to read about what food and nutrition trends I can expect to see in the year ahead. Here is my summary of the top three food and nutrition trends.
Top food and nutrition trend #1: Plant based push (vegetarian, veggie-centric, vegan, meatless meals, nut milks, legumes, meat substitutes and more)
Top food and nutrition trend #2: Mindfulness meets the grocery shelf (socially conscious, transparent, reducing food waste, non-GMO, ethical, fair trade, organic, local, natural, free of hormones and antibiotics, responsibly grown and raised).
Top food and nutrition trend #2: Gut health and reducing inflammation (probiotics, fermented foods, kombucha, drinking vinegars, fungi, turmeric, Za&#8217;atar, ginger, sparkling water, seltzers, FODMAP diet, gluten-free, elderflower, flowers in food, omega-3)</description><source>Health</source><pubDate>Thu, 28 Dec 2017 13:43:45 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/16487869.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /><a10:link rel="external" type="text/html" title="Top Nutrition and Food Trends for 2018: "plant based" tops the charts" href="http://calgaryherald.com/health/diet-fitness/holwegner-top-3-trends-in-the-food-restaurant-and-grocery-industry" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=16486488</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/health/local-health/yoga+detained+youths+helps+those+living+with+trauma/16486488/story.html</link><title>Yoga for detained B.C. youths helps those living with trauma trust their bodies</title><description>The yoga for youths in a Metro Vancouver detention centre may not look exactly like the yoga you&#8217;d find in a studio in Kitsilano. But despite the outward differences, it&#8217;s the kind of yoga that&#8217;s proving to be effective in helping incarcerated teenagers feel safe in their bodies. During a yoga session, for example, yoga [&#8230;]</description><source>Health</source><pubDate>Thu, 28 Dec 2017 00:39:26 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/16486489.jpg" That incident reverberated early this month when spine surgeon Marcel Dvorak cheerfully advised that the operation he would soon undertake on me would entail a fortnight [&#8230;]</description><source>Health</source><pubDate>Fri, 22 Dec 2017 21:00:29 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/16410868.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /><a10:link rel="external" type="text/html" title="Town Talk: My surgical kick by a horse for Christmas" href="http://vancouversun.com/health/local-health/town-talk-my-surgical-kick-by-a-horse-for-christmas" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=16378507</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/news/national/meet+canadians+choosing+live+their+vans+travel+full+time/16378507/story.html</link><title>Meet the Canadians who are choosing to live out of their vans and travel full-time</title><description>A community known as "van-lifers" share a desire for adventure, frustration with rental markets and, sometimes, social media fame</description><source>Health</source><pubDate>Fri, 22 Dec 2017 18:52:49 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/16406189.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /><a10:link rel="external" type="text/html" title="Meet the Canadians who are choosing to live out of their vans and travel full-time" href="http://nationalpost.com/news/canada/the-canadians-who-are-choosing-to-live-out-of-their-vans-and-travel-full-time" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=16401942</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/health/family-child/left+last+minute+some+novel+ideas+procrastinating/16401942/story.html</link><title>Left it to the last minute? Dr. Stewart Skinner, a&#160;clinical assistant professor&#160;in the College of Medicine, has been working closely with Indigenous communities around the province in [&#8230;]</description><source>Health</source><pubDate>Thu, 21 Dec 2017 22:33:20 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/15846661.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /><a10:link rel="external" type="text/html" title="Clinician awarded $2M grant to improve patient care in First Nation communities" href="http://thestarphoenix.com/health/sexual-health/clinician-awarded-2m-grant-to-improve-patient-care-in-first-nation-communities" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=16402228</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/health/keto+bottle+sports+drink+promises+benefits+strict+diet+within/16402228/story.html</link><title>Keto in a bottle?
